title: Apple could force 111-year-old Swiss firm to change its apple logo
content: Fruit Union Suisse, a 111-year-old Swiss company, is worried it might have to change its logo because Apple is trying to gain intellectual property rights over depictions of apples. "It's not like they're trying to protect their bitten apple...Their objective...is really to own rights to an actual apple, which...should be free for everyone to use," its director Jimmy Mariéthoz said.

title: Nissan's ex-CEO Carlos Ghosn sues automaker for $1 bn over ouster
content: Nissan's former CEO Carlos Ghosn has filed a $1-billion lawsuit against the Japanese automaker and connected individuals for ousting him in 2018 and arranging his arrest over alleged financial misconduct. Ghosn filed the lawsuit in Lebanon, where he has lived since escaping from Japan in 2019 to flee trial. In 2020, Nissan sued Ghosn for $90 million in monetary damages.

title: Financial influencer Ashesh & wife found running ₹300 cr drug racket, flee with ₹170 cr
content: Financial influencer Ashesh Mehta and his wife Shivangi have been accused of running a ₹300 crore drug distribution network from their home. The couple is reported to have fled the country after transferring more than ₹170 crore earned through the sale of drugs into various bank accounts. A look-out circular has been issued against the couple by Madhya Pradesh police.

title: Which are India's 10 most valuable listed private companies according to Hurun?
content: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable listed private company at ₹16,37,327 crore, according to a list released by Hurun India on Tuesday. It is followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, ITC, Infosys, HDFC, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and L&T. The total value of these companies is ₹71.4 lakh-crore, equivalent to more than one-third of India's GDP, Hurun said.

title: Rahul Shivshankar quits as Times Now Editor-in-Chief
content: Rahul Shivshankar has quit as the Editor-in-Chief of Times Now news channel, Newslaundry reported. "Rahul Shivshankar has decided to part ways with network...With immediate effect, the operations of the channel will be under the charge of Navika Kumar, Group Editor," an internal e-mail to employees reportedly said. Shivshankar joined the channel in 2016 after resigning as NewsX Editor-in-Chief.

title: Who is Shahzada Dawood, one of Pak's richest men on missing Titanic submarine?
content: Shahzada Dawood, one of Pakistan's richest men and Engro Corporation's Vice Chairman, went missing along with his son in the Atlantic Ocean on board the submarine taking tourists to visit Titanic's wreckage. He's also the Director of Dawood Hercules Corporation, which makes chemicals. Shahzada did his M.Sc in Global Textile Marketing from the US and LLB from Buckingham University.

title: SBI MD Swaminathan Janakiraman appointed as RBI Deputy Governor
content: Government on Tuesday appointed Swaminathan Janakiraman as Deputy Governor of the Reserve Bank of India for three years. He will succeed Mahesh Kumar Jain, whose tenure will end this week. Janakiraman is currently State Bank of India's MD. A panel comprising RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, Cabinet Secretary, Financial Services Secretary and the Chief Economic Advisor interviewed the candidates.

title: Air India signs agreement with Airbus, Boeing for 470 new aircraft
content: Air India on Tuesday finalised the agreements for the purchase of 470 aircraft from Boeing and Airbus at the 2023 Paris Air Show. "This landmark step further positions Air India for long-term growth and success that, we have every hope, will come together to represent the best of modern aviation to the world," Air India Chairman N Chandrasekaran said.

title: AI to pave way for millions of startups, generate jobs: Airbnb CEO
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky believes artificial intelligence (AI) will actually generate more jobs, particularly in entrepreneurship. In a recent interview, Chesky said the technology will propel "millions of new startups". He emphasised that it's easier to imagine jobs being displaced by AI than to envision the jobs that will be created, as it requires conceiving what does not exist yet.

title: Hexaware Technologies to hire 5,000-6,000 people: Executive
content: Hexaware Technologies is looking to hire 5,000-6,000 lateral talent for the current calendar year. "There is so much volatility in the market and most companies aren't hiring. We are standing apart where we are still hiring and in decent numbers," Senthil Nayagam K, EVP of global revenue assurance and Chief Learning Officer at Hexaware Technologies told Moneycontrol.

title: Hyundai to invest over $85 billion by 2032, boost EV production
content: Hyundai Motor has announced it plans to invest over $85 billion in the period through 2032. It said it will allocate around a third of this towards the electric vehicles market to meet a "seismic change" in the industry. The South Korean automaker added that it is targeting the sale of two million EV units annually by 2030.

title: Suzuki to temporarily close car plants in Pak amid import curbs
content: Pakistani subsidiary of Japanese automaker Suzuki has decided to keep its motorcycle and automobile plants in Pakistan closed from June 22-July 8 due to import restrictions, which affected inventory levels. This comes a week after Suzuki resumed operations at its four-wheeler unit in Pakistan that was shut for over 75 days. Its bike plant was closed from May 23-June 16.

title: Centre refusing rice to states to keep price rise in check: Goyal
content: Amid a political row over the refusal of rice supply to Karnataka, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the Centre has refused to provide rice to states from its stocks to ensure its price doesn't increase in the open market and maintain stocks. A committee decided that the states can purchase rice from the market if they need it, Goyal added.

title: Ryanair staffer says 'Tel Aviv is in Palestine', CEO apologises
content: Ryanair CEO Eddie Wilson issued an apology after a cabin crew member from the airline announced that "Tel Aviv is in Palestine" onboard a Bologna-Tel Aviv flight earlier this month. The announcement was made in Italian and English. "This was an innocent mistake with no intent and was immediately corrected and apologised for by the...crew member on board," Ryanair said.

title: IIFL Securities shares fall over 19% after SEBI ban
content: After the SEBI on Monday banned the stockbroking unit of IIFL Securities from onboarding any new client for two years, its shares fell over 19% in early trading on Tuesday. SEBI inspected operations and accounts of IIFL Securities between April 2011 and January 2017 and found several alleged rule violations. The violations included mixing client funds with IIFL's own funds.

title: Every dollar invested in civil aviation yields $3.1: Scindia
content: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said every dollar invested in civil aviation sector yields $3.1. "Every direct civil aviation job results in 6.1 indirect jobs in the sector...There are tremendous dividends that accrue from...civil aviation," Scindia said. "India has set another landmark with [IndiGo's] largest-ever recorded order by a carrier with any aircraft manufacturer," he added.

title: Zee's fundamentals worsening, SEBI order risks Sony merger: BofA
content: BofA Securities said that Zee Entertainment Enterprises' fundamentals are worsening due to "weak" business and SEBI's interim order against its promoters Subhash Chandra and Punit Goenka. The order puts Zee's proposed merger with Sony Pictures Networks India at risk, BofA added. It issued no rating for Zee, saying more clarity is needed on the merger and SEBI's order.

title: Restaurants get 1/3rd of their income from delivery apps: Report
content: Restaurants get about a third of their revenue from food delivery apps Zomato and Swiggy, a report by JM Financial claimed. The company had surveyed over 135 restaurants across top 10 cities. Even some of the branded restaurants said they've limited bargaining power over the delivery aggregators due to the latter's customer loyalty and diversified supplier base, the report said.

title: Akasa Air in talks with Boeing to order up to 10 more jets: Report
content: Akasa Air is in talks with Boeing to place a small follow-on order for 737 Max single-aisle jets, Bloomberg reported. However, as per the report, funding is an issue following the death of Akasa's billionaire Founder Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and the failure of Go Airlines. If an agreement comes together, Akasa may order 10 or fewer aircraft, Bloomberg said.

title: NSE, NCL settle trade glitch case, execs ordered community service
content: NSE and NSE Clearing (NCL) have settled a case with SEBI and paid over ₹72 crore for halting trading on February 24, 2021, following a technical glitch. SEBI also ordered NSE's ex-MD Vikram Limaye, NCL's MD Vikram Kothari and NSE's CTOO Shiv Kumar Bhasin to take necessary exams/courses and commit to at least 14-day community service over the next year.

title: Retail inflation for farm, rural workers eases in May
content: Retail inflation for farm workers and rural labourers eased to 5.99% and 5.84%, respectively, in May. Point-to-point rate of inflation based on the CPI-AL (consumer price index-agricultural labourers) and CPI-RL (rural labourers) stood at 6.50% and 6.52%, respectively in April 2023 and 6.67% and 7%, respectively during May 2022, the Labour Bureau stated.

title: IndiGo's 500 planes deal set another landmark for India: Scindia
content: After IndiGo signed a deal to buy 500 aircraft from Airbus, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "India has set another landmark with the largest-ever recorded order by a carrier with any aircraft manufacturer." "This order will act as an economic and employment multiplier. IndiGo's order is larger than the fleet that India had in 2014," Scindia added.

title: M-cap of BSE-listed firms hits new record high of ₹293.51 lakh cr
content: The market capitalisation (m-cap) of BSE-listed companies hit a fresh all-time high of ₹293.51 lakh crore on Tuesday as Sensex rose by 159.40 points to settle at 63,327.70. The m-cap of these firms touched a record of ₹292.78 lakh crore last Friday. Sensex is just 255.37 points away from its intra-day record peak of 63,583.07 hit on December 1, 2022.

title: Piramal Enterprises to sell full stake in Shriram Finance: Report
content: Piramal Enterprises has lined up an 8.34% stake for a block deal on June 21 to exit Shriram Finance. The floor price has been fixed at ₹1,483/equity share, CNBC-Awaaz cited sources as saying. Morgan Stanley will be the sole broker for the deal. On Monday, private equity firm TPG divested its entire 2.65% stake in Shriram Finance for ₹1,390 crore.

title: MS Dhoni sends no. 7 CSK jersey to Afghanistan's Rahmanullah Gurbaz, he shares pic
content: CSK captain MS Dhoni gifted his number seven jersey to Afghanistan wicketkeeper-batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz. Sharing a picture of himself holding the jersey, Gurbaz tweeted, "Thanks @msdhoni sir for sending the gift all the way from India." Gurbaz represented KKR in IPL 2023. He scored 227 runs with a strike rate of 133.53.

title: Usman Khawaja becomes 2nd Australian cricketer to bat on all 5 days of a Test match
content: Australia opener Usman Khawaja has become the second cricketer from his country to bat on all five days of a Test. The 36-year-old achieved the feat after coming in to bat on last day of the first Ashes 2023 Test at Edgbaston. Khawaja scored 141(321) in first innings and he started the Day 5 on 34*(81) in second innings.

title: Who sponsored the first-ever Cricket World Cup and how much money was spent?
content: The first-ever Cricket World Cup started on June 20, 1973 in the form of Women's Cricket World Cup in England. The tournament was sponsored by late British businessman Sir Jack Hayward, who provided monetary support to the event in the form of £40,000. He was a businessman known for owning football club Wolverhampton Wanderers from 1990 to 2007.

title: Virat Kohli completes 12 years in Test cricket, says 'Forever grateful'
content: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli on Tuesday completed 12 years in Test cricket. Sharing a picture of himself batting in the recent WTC 2023 final, Kohli wrote, "12 years in Test cricket today. Forever grateful." Kohli made his Test debut against West Indies in Kingston on June 20, 2011. Kohli has scored 8,479 runs in 185 Test innings so far.

title: Australia record their highest successful run chase in Ashes in 75 years
content: Australia chased down 281-run target against England in first Ashes 2023 Test at Edgbaston to record their highest successful chase in Ashes in nearly 75 years. Australia achieved the target with 4.3 overs remaining on the last day, driven by Usman Khawaja's 65(197) and captain Pat Cummins' 44*(73). Notably, England had declared their first innings at 393/8 on Day 1.

title: French police raids Paris 2024 Olympics headquarters
content: The headquarters of the Paris 2024 Olympics organising committee were raided by the police on Tuesday. As per reports, the raids were a part of two preliminary corruption investigations. "Paris 2024 is cooperating fully with the investigators to facilitate their inquiries," a spokesperson of the organising committee said.

title: Sikandar Raza smashes fastest hundred for Zimbabwe in ODI cricket history
content: All-rounder Sikandar Raza on Tuesday smashed the fastest hundred for Zimbabwe in ODI cricket history. The 37-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 54 deliveries in their ODI World Cup Qualifier 2023 match against Netherlands to set the record. The previous record was set by Sean Williams, who had slammed a 70-ball hundred against Nepal on June 18 (Sunday).

title: Don't get the chatter around Moeen Ali using a spray: Harbhajan
content: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh said the incident where England allrounder Moeen Ali applied drying agent spray on his bowling finger had been blown out of proportion. "Don't understand so much chatter around Moeen Ali using spray...only issue is he should have informed the umpires," tweeted Singh. Ali was fined 25 per cent of his match fee over the incident.

title: Bairstow will draw very loud criticism if England lose: Vaughan
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan said England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow will draw "very loud" criticism if England lose the Edgbaston Test against Australia. "I don't think he is a natural gloveman...On these kind of pitches, you start thinking, 'When is the next chance coming?'" added Vaughan. "You really do have to make sure you are switched on," stated Vaughan.

title: It was most awful time of my life: Eng's Duckett on 2017/18 Ashes
content: Talking about the 2017/18 Ashes where he poured a drink over English pacer James Anderson's head resulting in fine and suspension, English opener Ben Duckett said, "It was the most awful time [of] my life." "No one believed anything [that] I said. I had to go away," added Duckett. "It was a ridiculous situation...blown out of proportion," he stated.

title: I fit the criteria to win the Ballon d'Or this year: PSG's Mbappe
content: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe feels he has done enough to win Ballon d'Or this year. "Do I deserve the Ballon d'Or? With the new criteria, what counts? Catching the eye, scoring goals and making an impact? I think I fit those criteria," said Mbappe. The France striker added that he'd swap his World Cup final hat-trick to win the title.

title: Video shows Haaland choosing the best of his 52 goals this season
content: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland chose his strike against former team Borussia Dortmund as his favourite goal of the season. Haaland, who scored 52 goals in the 2022-2023 season, scored the winner against Dortmund in the 84th minute at the Etihad Stadium. Manchester City eventually went on to win the Champions League title, thus completing a historic treble.

title: MLS history will have a before & after Messi: Inter Miami owner
content: Inter Miami's Managing Owner Jorge Mas said Argentina forward Lionel Messi's move to MLS would be a landmark. "I think there will always be a before and after Messi...[he] is going to be the greatest ambassador and recruiter in the history of MLS," said Mas. He added that MLS can become "one of the top two leagues in the world".

title: Many goals will be scored, Pak could pose surprise: India's Stimac
content: Talking about the 2023 SAFF Championship where India will face Pakistan in their opening match, India head coach Igor Stimac said, "The crowd will love it as there'll be...lot of goals." "Pakistan could be the surprise package of the tournament...They could be very competitive...It does not matter that they haven't got the results going their way recently," added Stimac.

title: Video shows Sheamus smashing 30 Beats of Bodhran on Pretty Deadly
content: The WWE has shared a video that shows WWE superstar Sheamus 'smashing 30 Beats of the Bodhran' on WWE wrestling tag team 'Pretty Deadly' members Elton Prince and Kit Wilson. Sheamus was seen executing the move during a WWE match. Sheamus, who's also known as 'The Celtic Warrior', drew appreciation from members of the audience while engaging in this act.

title: England should use Root as spinner during 2nd Ashes Test: Hussain
content: Former England captain Nasser Hussain said England can play four pacers and use Joe Root as their off-spin option in the second Ashes Test at Lord's. "It doesn't always turn there (at Lord's)...you may need your spinner there in a holding role," said Hussain. His suggestion came after Ali had a blister on his index finger and struggled to bowl.

title: We've been asked to entertain, we will attack Australia: Anderson
content: England pacer James Anderson claimed that the hosts will continue to push to take Australia's remaining seven wickets and win the first Ashes Test match. "We will...set attacking fields...What we are asked to do is entertain and send people home happy...We are trying to do something special," said Anderson. Meanwhile, Australia began day five needing 174 runs to win.

title: Sachin told Laxman 'You can see the ball earlier than me': Prasad
content: Ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad shared an anecdote about an interaction between Sachin Tendulkar and VVS Laxman, in the book 'Sachin@50: Celebrating a Maestro'. "Sachin...[told] Laxman, 'You can see the ball...split second earlier than me. God has given you exceptional talent which you're unable to understand. God gave me minimum talent, which I'm maximising'," shared Prasad as quoted.

title: Video shows Roman Reigns' brothers attacking him on WWE SmackDown
content: WWE shared a video of Undisputed WWE Universal champion Roman Reigns being attacked by his cousin brothers 'The Usos' on SmackDown. The trio had been aligning, with Reigns as their leader under the moniker 'The Bloodline'. Jey Uso, when asked to choose between his brother Jimmy and Reigns, chose to attack the SmackDown champion, much to the crowd's delight.

title: Lionel Messi will make his Inter Miami debut on July 21: Co-owner
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said he expects Argentina forward Lionel Messi to make his debut for the club in their Leagues Cup match against Cruz Azul on July 21. Messi recently joined Inter Miami on a reported two-and-a-half-year deal. The Argentine will reportedly have a stake in the MLS club and earn around $50-$60 million per year.

title: Premier League shares video of 'high IQ moments' during matches
content: The Premier League has shared a video of 'high IQ moments' by players from various clubs in the league. The video shows a variety of assists and goals scored by players, including former stars like Manchester United's Wayne Rooney and Arsenal's Thierry Henry. Furthermore, former Liverpool forward Luis Suarez and ex-Chelsea captain Cesc Fabregas feature in the video.

title: Eng have full buy in to be best team just like CSK: De Villiers
content: Ex-South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers termed England's Test team as a side which has full buy in to be the best just like MS Dhoni-led CSK. "The best teams are prepared to play situations in a way that’ll put them in a winning position more often...whether that’s by making bold declarations or playing [many] reverse sweeps," added De Villiers.

title: Why won't I celebrate my once in a lifetime treble win?: Grealish
content: Manchester City forward Jack Grealish defended his celebrations post the team's treble win and said the moment "comes around once in a lifetime". "It hasn't been done for ages. So why not celebrate like that?...the best weekend of my life...probably...the biggest emotional high ever," said Grealish. The English winger added that he wasn't alone in celebrating Man City's titles.

title: Perry thought she'd got 200 but hadn't, saw her other side: Healy
content: Sharing an anecdote from Australia Women's Test match against England in November 2017, Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy said her team's all-rounder Ellyse Perry thought she'd scored a 200 following a big hit. "We literally saw Perry's other side...[when she was told] it wasn't actually a six, so she hadn't reached 200 yet," added Healy. Perry went on to score 213*.

title: The team that wins Edgbaston Test will win Ashes 2023: Vaughan
content: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said the team that wins the Edgbaston Test will go on to win Ashes 2023. "If England get the win, then Ben Stokes will continue to [be] ultra-aggressive. If England lose, they'll face...many questions about the declaration," he added. "If Australia lose, then Pat Cummins [will be] under...spotlight...There'll be fingers pointed [at] whoever loses," he stated.

title: WhatsApp lets users silence calls from unknown numbers amid rise in spam calls
content: WhatsApp is introducing a new feature to automatically silence calls from unknown numbers, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced on Tuesday. The feature comes after several people in India complained about an increase in spam calls in the last few months. While calls from unknown numbers will be automatically silenced, they will show up in notifications and the app's call list.

title: Google plans to assemble Pixel phones in India: Report
content: Google is looking for suppliers in India to assemble its Pixel smartphones, Bloomberg reported. Google has begun early conversations with companies including homegrown Lava and Dixon Technologies and Foxconn's Indian unit Bharat FIH. Google's potential partners have won the government's production-linked financial incentives, which Apple used to increase its iPhone production in India.

title: Suzuki to start making 'flying cars' with SkyDrive by 2024 spring
content: Japanese automaker Suzuki said it has signed a basic agreement with SkyDrive to manufacture "flying cars" in Japan. SkyDrive will establish a 100% owned subsidiary to manufacture the cars and both firms will utilise a Suzuki-owned plant in Japan's Shizuoka Prefecture for the manufacturing process, Suzuki said. The two firms aim to start production by spring of 2024, it added.

title: Realme disables feature amid claims it collected SMS, call data
content: Realme has released a new update for some models that disables the 'Enhanced Intelligent Services' feature by default. This comes after claims were made that the feature was collecting users' personal data like call logs and SMS messages, and was enabled by default. The latest update also removes the mention of call logs and messages from the feature's description.

title: What is the Pink WhatsApp scam that authorities have warned people about?
content: Authorities from several states have warned people about Pink WhatsApp scam, based on a Central government advisory. "A fake link that is masked as an official update...is sent to Android users. Upon clicking it, malicious software may get installed...The user's phone can be infected and it can also infect mobiles of people who contact the user over WhatsApp," it said.

title: How can you silence calls from unknown numbers on WhatsApp?
content: WhatsApp users can now automatically silence calls from unknown numbers. The option will be available under privacy section of settings on the app. Selecting the 'Silence unknown callers' option will no longer allow such WhatsApp calls to ring on the user's phone. WhatsApp will automatically screen out spam, scams, and calls from unknown people for users who select this feature.

title: Apple could force 111-year-old Swiss firm to change its apple logo
content: Fruit Union Suisse, a 111-year-old Swiss company, is worried it might have to change its logo because Apple is trying to gain intellectual property rights over depictions of apples. "It's not like they're trying to protect their bitten apple...Their objective...is really to own rights to an actual apple, which...should be free for everyone to use," its director Jimmy Mariéthoz said.

title: Reddit flooded with British comedian's pics to protest API charges
content: Reddit users have flooded the site with British comedian John Oliver's pictures to protest against Reddit's new API pricing. This comes after thousands of subreddits locked users out as part of same protest, replying to which CEO Steve Huffman said, "Like all blowups on Reddit, this one will pass as well." Oliver shared his pics on Twitter following the protest.

title: This AI breakthrough is redefining healthcare diagnosis!
content: This AI breakthrough is redefining healthcare diagnosis!

title: Reddit CEO talk about API changes, feedback and vision for the platform's future in a candid interview
content: Reddit CEO talk about API changes, feedback and vision for the platform's future in a candid interview

title: Adobe's $20-bn deal to acquire Figma under scrutiny in EU: Report
content: European antitrust regulators are preparing to launch a formal investigation into Adobe's $20-billion buyout deal for cloud-based designer platform Figma over concerns it'll lead to less innovation and higher prices, Financial Times reported. The deal is reportedly already being probed in the UK. The US Justice Department is also reportedly preparing a lawsuit to block the transaction.

title: India won't miss $300-bn electronics manufacturing target: MoS IT
content: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has denied a CNBC-TV18 report, which cited sources to claim that India is likely to miss its $300-billion target for electronics manufacturing by FY26. "We see no reason or sign that we will underperform on our targets unless these 'sources' know something about the future that we don't," Chandrasekhar stated.

title: Tech startups have seen solid growth despite meltdowns: MoS IT
content: Minister of State for Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar said technology startups have seen "solid growth despite all the occasional meltdowns" we saw in the early 2000s. "If your nose is following just the valuation curve, you're bound to keep doing this sinusoidal [motion]. But if you average that out...you'll see that there's been a consistent growth in value," he added.

title: iPhone's crash detection triggers false 911 calls at US festival
content: Apple iPhone's crash detection feature triggered multiple accidental 911 calls at a recently-concluded music and arts festival in the US, as per a tweet by local police. "Please be mindful and consider deactivating this feature on your phone until Bonnaroo concludes," the police told attendees. According to Apple, the feature is designed to detect severe car crashes.

title: AI to pave way for millions of startups, generate jobs: Airbnb CEO
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky believes artificial intelligence (AI) will actually generate more jobs, particularly in entrepreneurship. In a recent interview, Chesky said the technology will propel "millions of new startups". He emphasised that it's easier to imagine jobs being displaced by AI than to envision the jobs that will be created, as it requires conceiving what does not exist yet.

title: Israeli scientists develop AI tool to translate 5,000-yr-old texts
content: Israeli scientists have developed an AI tool based on neural language processing to help translate around 5,000-year-old writing system Cuneiform. "What's so amazing about it is that I don't need to understand Akkadian at all to translate...and get what's behind Cuneiform," a scientist said. The tool returned a score of 36.52 on an accuracy analysis tool with a 0-100 range.

title: We seek to deepen India-US ties in trade, commerce, tech: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who's set to meet business leaders in America, said he'll discuss opportunities for elevating trade and investment relationships with some of the leading CEOs. "We seek to deepen India-USA ties in key sectors like trade, commerce, innovation, technology and other such areas," he tweeted. He's set to meet world's richest man Elon Musk, among other people.

title: Apple Watch helped detect blood clot, saved my life: US woman
content: A US woman claimed her life was saved after she received an Apple Watch alert that said her heart rate was around 178 beats per minute. Kimmie Watkins said she was sleeping when she got alerted about the abnormally high heart rate. A doctor later told her she had saddle pulmonary embolism, a life-threatening blood clot in the lungs.

title: What's Anonymous Sudan, the hacker group behind Microsoft outages?
content: Anonymous Sudan is a hacker group that has been linked to the recent outages that affected services of American company Microsoft. The group claims to be "hacktivists" from Sudan. However, some cybersecurity experts alleged that it's likely to be a Russia-linked gang. Swedish company Truesec believes Anonymous Sudan works to spread pro-Kremlin propaganda and target Ukraine's allies in the West.

title: Anybody with an AI startup can command their value: MoS IT
content: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said anybody with an AI startup can command their value. Semiconductor and AI compute startups are seeing growth in valuation, Chandrasekhar said. "[We've] seen Nvidia's valuation. Just a few years ago, it was just another semiconductor company struggling to make high-performance gaming boards. Now they're almost a trillion dollar company," he added.

title: AI to impact developers, but can't do integrating role: Ola ex-CTO
content: Ola's Co-founder and former CTO Ankit Bhati said the developer ecosystem will be impacted by artificial intelligence. However, he added that the impact will be less in terms of replacement and more in terms of leverage. "The integrating role of a developer is not going anywhere, AI cannot do that," he further stated.

title: ISRO to set up mobile satellite terminals on 1 lakh fishing boats
content: ISRO's commercial arm NewSpace India will install mobile satellite service terminals on at least one lakh fishing boats across nine states and four union territories. The network will help authorities send emergency weather alerts and alert fishermen about international water border violations. India's navigation satellite system NavIC (Navigation with Indian Constellation) will power the network.

title: US' largest publisher Gannett sues Google over ad tech monopoly
content: Gannett, the largest news publisher in the US, has sued Google, alleging it has monopolised the technology tools that publishers and advertisers use to buy and sell ad space. News publishers are forced by Google to sell ad space to the company at low prices, the lawsuit claims. "These claims are simply wrong," Google Ads VP Dan Taylor said.

title: Twitter owner Elon Musk, CEO Yaccarino to skip Cannes Lions event
content: Twitter owner Elon Musk and CEO Linda Yaccarino are set to skip Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity, a spokesperson confirmed. The event attracts the industry's influential executives and key advertisers. Twitter's sales team is in Cannes for the event, a report said. On Tuesday, Twitter said it'll explore solutions from companies that specialise in tracking the quality of ads.

title: Hexaware Technologies to hire 5,000-6,000 people: Executive
content: Hexaware Technologies is looking to hire 5,000-6,000 lateral talent for the current calendar year. "There is so much volatility in the market and most companies aren't hiring. We are standing apart where we are still hiring and in decent numbers," Senthil Nayagam K, EVP of global revenue assurance and Chief Learning Officer at Hexaware Technologies told Moneycontrol.

title: Sunny Deol's son Karan Deol shares unseen pics from his wedding
content: Actor Sunny Deol's son Karan Deol took to Instagram to share unseen pictures from his wedding to Drisha Acharya. He wrote, "Grateful for the abundant blessings and the support of our cherished family, with hearts overflowing, we express gratitude and gratefulness." In one of the photos, Karan and Drisha can be seen posing with Dharmendra and Prakash Kaur.

title: I was molested by family doctor, had my Class 10 exam the next day: Actress Jiya Shankar
content: Actress Jiya Shankar said that she was molested by her family doctor when she was in Class 10. She added she had visited the family doctor after falling sick a day before her Class 10 board exam. She further said, "I was a kid. How'd I know he'd take advantage of me knowing...my mom and dad aren't living together anymore?"

title: Ravan was very knowledgeable, 'Adipurush' blackened golden Lanka: Ramanand Sagar's son
content: Ramanand Sagar's son Prem, while talking about the controversy over 'Adipurush', said, "Manoj Muntashir is well-informed about Hinduism. I don't understand how he even conceived such dialogues in the film." He added, "Ravan was very knowledgeable and you are blackening the golden Lanka (sone ki Lanka), and his look with five heads up and five heads down."

title: If Lord Hanuman saw 'Adipurush', he'd throw a mountain on the film's team: Mukesh Khanna
content: Actor Mukesh Khanna has criticised Om Raut directorial 'Adipurush', saying that the iteration of Ramayana is "miles away from any of the Ramayana scriptures". He said, "If Lord Hanuman saw this, he would pick up a mountain and throw it on the film's team." He added, "The entire team should be made to stand in a corner in 50°C temperature."

title: Welcome to the parents' club: Jr NTR to Ram Charan & Upasana
content: Jr NTR congratulated his 'RRR' co-star Ram Charan and his wife Upasana Konidela on becoming parents to a baby girl. "Welcome to...parents' club. Every moment spent with...baby girl will be an unforgettable memory for a lifetime. May God bless her and you all with immense happiness," Jr NTR tweeted. Samantha Ruth Prabhu expressed that she's "happy" for the couple.

title: Aamir didn't like 'Aati Kya...' first shoot, scrapped it: Lalit
content: Music composer Lalit Pandit revealed that Aamir Khan didn't like the way 'Aati Kya Khandala' was shot initially. "He scrapped the song's first shooting and they had to re-shoot the song and this time it was mind-blowing," he added. The song was a part of the 1998 film 'Ghulam', which was directed by Vikram Bhatt.

title: I was paid ₹10,000 for my first album as actor: Krushna Abhishek
content: Krushna Abhishek recalled shooting his "first ever album" for which he was paid ₹10,000. "This album was 20 years back when I was struggling for work...this song was a super hit in Punjab," the actor shared. Rajiv Thakur and Bharti Singh commented on the video. "I watched it...but never came in my mind that it was you," Rajiv wrote.

title: Showing off body won't make you Lord Ram: Mukesh on Prabhas
content: Actor Mukesh Khanna shared his opinion on Prabhas' performance as Lord Ram in 'Adipurush' and said that while "he is a good human being and a good actor", he has not understood the essence of Ram. "You have to imbibe Ram and let him enter your heart to play him on-screen. Showing off...body won't make anyone Lord Ram," said Mukesh.

title: Use AK-47 then: Lahri on 'Adipurush' being called modern Ramayan
content: Actor Sunil Lahri reacted to claims that 'Adipurush' is a "modern" take on Ramayan. "[If it's being called modern Ramayan] they should've used machine gun or AK-47 instead of bows and arrows...why were they walking in the forest on their foot, they could've used Mercedes or BMW," Lahri opined. "I don't think 'Adipurush' would've earned over ₹300 crore," he added.

title: Of course, they do: Akshay on if box office numbers bother him
content: Akshay Kumar, replying to a question on whether his film's box office numbers bother him, said, "Of course, they do." He added that actors are "made or broken" because of the box office collection. "The audiences tell us when we are right and where we are going wrong, and all that is reflected in the box office numbers," said Akshay.

title: Deepika-Ranveer dance with Sunny Deol, family at Karan's reception
content: A video of Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh surfaced on internet in which the two were seen dancing with Sunny Deol and his family at Karan Deol's wedding reception. The video, which featured Sonu Nigam singing 'Om Shanti Om' song, also showed Karan and his wife Drisha Acharya dancing together. Karan and Drisha got married on June 18.

title: God has taken his time to make him perfect: Rashmika on Ranbir
content: Rashmika Mandanna, in her latest Instagram Story, shared her experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor in the upcoming film 'Animal'. Describing Ranbir as a brilliant actor and an amazing human being, she wrote, "God has really taken his time to make him perfect." "What a beautiful human he is...I only wish the best for him for life," wrote Rashmika.

title: Could've made superhero film: Ramanand Sagar's son on 'Adipurush'
content: Ramanand Sagar's son Prem Sagar said that 'Adipurush' makers can take cinematic liberty but when they've called the film inspired from Ramayan, they have a responsibility. "If they've used the word Ramayan...[distortion of characters and story] is unacceptable. They could've made...superhero film...Characters like Lord Ram, Goddess Sita...have limitations, which shouldn't be crossed," he said.

title: Had to sell my car & house: Avinash Sachdev on financial struggles
content: Actor Avinash Sachdev opened up about facing financial struggles following the closure of his restaurant and said he had to sell his house and car. "All my savings were gone...I was also having anxiety attacks," he added. "I didn't need to take help from any therapist, psychiatrist or pills. I could handle it," said Avinash.

title: Saif Ali Khan performed well in 'Adipurush': 'Ramayan' actor Sunil
content: 'Ramayan' actor Sunil Lahri in an interview said that Saif Ali Khan performed well as Raavan in 'Adipurush'. On being asked about 'Tel tere baap ka, kapra tere baap ka aur jalegi bhi tere baap ki' dialogue in the film, Sunil said that it was cheap to make the character of Lord Hanuman speak such dialogues.

title: Indians are now respected all over the world: Kumar Sanu
content: Singer Kumar Sanu in an interview shared how India and Indians are now treated with respect all over the world. He said that foreigners' feelings towards India have "totally changed". "Their outlook on India has changed and it is clearly visible when we cross the immigration or go to any market," Sanu further said.

title: I'll launch you if you want to be actor: Kher to Satish's daughter
content: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of his conversation with late actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik's daughter Vanshika Kaushik. In the video, he was seen telling Vanshika, "If you ever want to be an actor, not only I'll train you personally as...actor, as a teacher, I'll also launch you in a film." Satish passed away earlier this year.

title: I wish my late father was here so I could say 'I love you': Dwayne
content: Actor Dwayne Johnson said that he wishes his late father was around so that he could say "I love you" to him. "I wish...I could say 'Happy Father's Day' just one more time. I would say this..if you guys have your old man around...try and reconcile, try and bring it back together," Johnson further said.

title: Thought 'How'll I do it': Suhail on intimate scenes with Tamannaah
content: Actor Suhail Nayyar, while talking about doing intimate scenes with Tamannaah Bhatia in the show 'Jee Karda', said that he was very nervous before their first intimate scene. "I was like, 'Oh my God!, how I am going to do this'," he added. Suhail further said Tamannaah made him feel very comfortable.

title: Prabhas, Saif could've demanded bound script: Lahri on 'Adipurush'
content: Sunil Lahri, who played Laxman in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', said he is "really shocked" how 'Adipurush' released. "Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan could've demanded bound script...I really feel that everyone was just blindfolded or hypnotised that they made such a film," Lahri shared. The actor said the makers should apologise and the film should be banned.

title: I deny all allegations: TMKOC's Asit Modi on FIR against him
content: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah's producer Asit Kumarr Modi has denied "all allegations" against him, Sohail Ramani (Project Head) and Jatin Bajaj (Executive Producer). The producer, who was accused of sexual harassment by Jennifer Mistry, said he's not aware if an FIR has been registered. "In any case, the matter is under investigation...no further comments," he said in a statement.

title: Someone linked us up, there was no love angle: Vivek on Divyanka
content: Vivek Dahiya shared that though he was working with his wife Divyanka Tripathi, they had "never interacted" with each other. "There was no time for friendship, we directly started dating...That happened because someone linked us up otherwise there was no love angle...It was...arranged marriage," Vivek said. The actor recalled that his co-star told him that Divyanka was "perfect" for him.

title: Ramayana not for entertainment value: Chikhlia on 'Adipurush' row
content: Dipika Chikhlia, who was seen in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', said that "Ramayana is not for entertainment value" but it is something to learn from. "What really pains me is why are we constantly trying to make Ramayana every year or two years," she shared and added that any kind of deviance from the Hindu epic will encounter criticism.

title: Used to sit in gay bars: Sayani on preparing for role of a lesbian
content: Sayani Gupta spoke about how she prepared for her role in 'Margarita with a Straw' in which she played a homosexual character. She said for two weeks, she used to go and sit in gay bars in New York, which she said was "very weird". "There were things...I was seeing and learning for...first time. It was extremely educational," said Sayani.

title: Mohalle ki chindi ladayi: Mukesh Khanna on Adipurush's war scenes
content: Actor Mukesh Khanna criticised the war sequences in 'Adipurush'. "In the name of war, they've shown 'mohalle ki chindi ladayi'. Like where they throw punches and hit each other with legs," Khanna said. He said the film is "too inspired by Hollywood movies" and the makers should've made "a video game" instead of spending ₹600 crore on the film.
